title: Saturday's fourth shooting in Savannah under investigation
content:
SAVANNAH, Ga. —
UPDATE: 9:00 a.m.
WJCL has learned the shooting near Richards and West Street injured 17 year-old, Traymon Kimble. Kimble was taken to the hospital with non-life threatening injuries.
Kimble was reportedly walking on West Street when unknown people in a passing vehicle shot him.
The case remains under investigation.
--
Savannah-Chatham Metropolitan Police investigators are working to find out what led to the fourth shooting in Savannah on Saturday. This shooting resulted in a man being injured.
Investigators say a man received non-life threatening injuries from the shooting, which happened at about 11:45 p.m. on Richards Street.
Richards Street between West Street and Way Street was closed for a period of time during the investigation.
At this time police have not identified any suspects.
Anyone with information should call CrimeStoppers at (912) 234-2020.
